intro: Chamerion caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in terminal clusters. Chamerion caucasicum is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
